intro: Paraboea angustifolia, commonly known as the narrow-leaf paraboea, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It is a member of the Rubiaceae family, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant typically grows as a shrub with opposite, lance-shaped leaves. Its flowers are small, clustered, and often white or pale pink, appearing in spring. It is valued in horticulture for its ornamental foliage and ability to thrive in shaded environments.
